summary.overall_findings: Hartford Insurance's published materials include a policy document outlining a governance framework for Generative AI tools with review and approval processes. This documentation addresses 6 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars, with further governance disclosures describing employee responsibility for aligning AI use with company standards. Transparency, fairness, explainability, privacy, and external accountability are addressed through policy documents or reports, such as a report describing the use of AI in pricing and risk selection, and another referencing independent audits and testing of models. No qualifying public evidence was found for oversight, with the assessment drawing on 13 publicly available sources.
